trans-unit.source: Deploying ACS Federated Applications and Services To Azure
trans-unit.target: Deploying ACS Federated Applications and Services To Azure

trans-unit.source: Deploying ACS Federated Applications and Service To Azure
trans-unit.target: Deploying ACS Federated Applications and Service To Azure

trans-unit.source: Applies To
trans-unit.target: Applies To

trans-unit.source: Windows Identity Foundation (WIF)
trans-unit.target: Windows Identity Foundation (WIF)

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: This topic consolidates the guidelines that you should take into account when you develop applications and services that use <token>secondref_acs</token> and that will be deployed to <token>azure_2</token>.
trans-unit.target: This topic consolidates the guidelines that you should take into account when you develop applications and services that use <token>secondref_acs</token> and that will be deployed to <token>azure_2</token>.

trans-unit.source: Objectives
trans-unit.target: Objectives

trans-unit.source: Work around dynamically generated ports with Compute Emulator.
trans-unit.target: Work around dynamically generated ports with Compute Emulator.

trans-unit.source: Deploy Windows Identity Foundation (WIF) runtime to <token>azure_2</token>.
trans-unit.target: Deploy Windows Identity Foundation (WIF) runtime to <token>azure_2</token>.

trans-unit.source: Encrypt cookies using RSA.
trans-unit.target: Encrypt cookies using RSA.

trans-unit.source: Configure assemblies invoked through reflection to be deployed to <token>azure_2</token>.
trans-unit.target: Configure assemblies invoked through reflection to be deployed to <token>azure_2</token>.

trans-unit.source: Work around dynamically generated ports with Compute Emulator
trans-unit.target: Work around dynamically generated ports with Compute Emulator

trans-unit.source: This section is relevant when you create web applications.
trans-unit.target: This section is relevant when you create web applications.

trans-unit.source: It is not relevant when you create web services.
trans-unit.target: It is not relevant when you create web services.

trans-unit.source: Compute Emulator is part of <token>azure_2</token> SDK tools.
trans-unit.target: Compute Emulator is part of <token>azure_2</token> SDK tools.

trans-unit.source: You can use it to run, test, debug, and fine-tune your application before you deploy it as a hosted service to <token>azure_2</token>.
trans-unit.target: You can use it to run, test, debug, and fine-tune your application before you deploy it as a hosted service to <token>azure_2</token>.

trans-unit.source: In Compute Emulator, it is not possible to allocate a unique IP address.
trans-unit.target: In Compute Emulator, it is not possible to allocate a unique IP address.

trans-unit.source: Compute Emulator attempts to assign the requested port.
trans-unit.target: Compute Emulator attempts to assign the requested port.

trans-unit.source: If that port is not available, it allocates the next best available port number.
trans-unit.target: If that port is not available, it allocates the next best available port number.

trans-unit.source: This means that in the Compute Emulator, your service might be assigned a different port number from the port number that you specified in the definition file.
trans-unit.target: This means that in the Compute Emulator, your service might be assigned a different port number from the port number that you specified in the definition file.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Compute Emulator, see <externalLink><linkText>Overview of the Windows Azure Compute Emulator</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221212</linkUri></externalLink> (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221212).
trans-unit.target: For more information about Compute Emulator, see <externalLink><linkText>Overview of the Windows Azure Compute Emulator</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221212</linkUri></externalLink> (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221212).

trans-unit.source: If Compute Emulator allocates an IP address different from the IP address that is configured as the <ui>Return URL</ui> in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, <token>secondref_acs</token> will redirect authenticated requests to the URL that is configured in the <ui>Return URL</ui> field of the relying party configuration, but no matching page in this URL will exist.
trans-unit.target: If Compute Emulator allocates an IP address different from the IP address that is configured as the <ui>Return URL</ui> in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, <token>secondref_acs</token> will redirect authenticated requests to the URL that is configured in the <ui>Return URL</ui> field of the relying party configuration, but no matching page in this URL will exist.

trans-unit.source: As a result you will be presented with blank page.
trans-unit.target: As a result you will be presented with blank page.

trans-unit.source: To work around this behavior, configure your cloud web application’s endpoint public port to a port that is available on your computer.
trans-unit.target: To work around this behavior, configure your cloud web application’s endpoint public port to a port that is available on your computer.

trans-unit.source: Then, Compute Emulator will not assign a random port to avoid a collision.
trans-unit.target: Then, Compute Emulator will not assign a random port to avoid a collision.

trans-unit.source: To configure the endpoint to use an available port
trans-unit.target: To configure the endpoint to use an available port

trans-unit.source: To open the command prompt, click <ui>Start</ui>, type <ui>cmd</ui>, and then press <ui>Enter</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To open the command prompt, click <ui>Start</ui>, type <ui>cmd</ui>, and then press <ui>Enter</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to display the list of local host IP addresses with used ports: <system>netstat –a –n | findstr 127.0.0.1</system>
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to display the list of local host IP addresses with used ports: <system>netstat –a –n | findstr 127.0.0.1</system>

trans-unit.source: Scan through the list, and identify a port that is not currently in use.
trans-unit.target: Scan through the list, and identify a port that is not currently in use.

trans-unit.source: You will use this port in the following steps.
trans-unit.target: You will use this port in the following steps.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>, double-click your role, which is located under the <ui>Roles</ui> folder in the cloud project.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>, double-click your role, which is located under the <ui>Roles</ui> folder in the cloud project.

trans-unit.source: The role properties page opens.
trans-unit.target: The role properties page opens.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Web Role Properties</ui> page, click the <ui>Endpoints</ui> tab.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Web Role Properties</ui> page, click the <ui>Endpoints</ui> tab.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Public Port </ui> file, specify the port value that you identified in <ui>Step 3</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Public Port </ui> file, specify the port value that you identified in <ui>Step 3</ui>.

trans-unit.source: To save your work, press Ctrl+S.
trans-unit.target: To save your work, press Ctrl+S.

trans-unit.source: Deploy Windows Identity Foundation runtime to Windows Azure
trans-unit.target: Deploy Windows Identity Foundation runtime to Windows Azure

trans-unit.source: Windows Identity Foundation (WIF) is an out-of-band runtime that must be installed on the computer so that your claims-aware application can use it.
trans-unit.target: Windows Identity Foundation (WIF) is an out-of-band runtime that must be installed on the computer so that your claims-aware application can use it.

trans-unit.source: WIF is not installed by default on <token>azure_2</token> instances.
trans-unit.target: WIF is not installed by default on <token>azure_2</token> instances.

trans-unit.source: To run your cloud claims-aware application, you must make WIF runtime available on the <token>azure_2</token> instance.
trans-unit.target: To run your cloud claims-aware application, you must make WIF runtime available on the <token>azure_2</token> instance.

trans-unit.source: The easiest way is to do this is to include the WIF assembly with the deployment package.
trans-unit.target: The easiest way is to do this is to include the WIF assembly with the deployment package.

trans-unit.source: To include the WIF assembly with the Windows Azure deployment package
trans-unit.target: To include the WIF assembly with the Windows Azure deployment package

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>, locate your claims-aware application.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>, locate your claims-aware application.

trans-unit.source: Expand the <ui>References</ui> folder.
trans-unit.target: Expand the <ui>References</ui> folder.

trans-unit.source: Locate the <ui>Microsoft.IdentityModel</ui> assembly under the <ui>References</ui> folder.
trans-unit.target: Locate the <ui>Microsoft.IdentityModel</ui> assembly under the <ui>References</ui> folder.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the assembly, and then click <ui>Properties</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the assembly, and then click <ui>Properties</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the properties window, specify <ui>Copy Local </ui> as <ui>True</ui> and <ui>Specific Version</ui> as <ui>False</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the properties window, specify <ui>Copy Local </ui> as <ui>True</ui> and <ui>Specific Version</ui> as <ui>False</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Encrypt cookies using RSA
trans-unit.target: Encrypt cookies using RSA

trans-unit.source: This section is relevant when you create web applications.
trans-unit.target: This section is relevant when you create web applications.

trans-unit.source: By default, WIF protects cookies cryptographically using data protection application programming interfaces (DPAPI).
trans-unit.target: By default, WIF protects cookies cryptographically using data protection application programming interfaces (DPAPI).

trans-unit.source: DPAPI is not available on <token>azure_2</token>.
trans-unit.target: DPAPI is not available on <token>azure_2</token>.

trans-unit.source: To make sure that your cloud claims-aware web application functions correctly when it is deployed to <token>azure_2</token>, you must add cookies encryption functionality using RSA.
trans-unit.target: To make sure that your cloud claims-aware web application functions correctly when it is deployed to <token>azure_2</token>, you must add cookies encryption functionality using RSA.

trans-unit.source: To encrypt cookies using RSA
trans-unit.target: To encrypt cookies using RSA

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>, locate your cloud claims-aware web application.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>, locate your cloud claims-aware web application.

trans-unit.source: Open the <ui>global.asax.cs</ui> file, which is the code behind the <ui>global.asax</ui> file, in the <token>vs_current_short</token> editor.
trans-unit.target: Open the <ui>global.asax.cs</ui> file, which is the code behind the <ui>global.asax</ui> file, in the <token>vs_current_short</token> editor.

trans-unit.source: Add the following declarations:
trans-unit.target: Add the following declarations:

trans-unit.source: Add the following code:
trans-unit.target: Add the following code:

trans-unit.source: If you have already added the Application_Start event handler, you can update it to include this code.
trans-unit.target: If you have already added the Application_Start event handler, you can update it to include this code.

trans-unit.source: Save your work.
trans-unit.target: Save your work.

trans-unit.source: Configure assemblies that are invoked through reflection to be deployed to Windows Azure
trans-unit.target: Configure assemblies that are invoked through reflection to be deployed to Windows Azure

trans-unit.source: In some cases, assemblies are invoked through reflection, for example, when developing Representational State Transfer (REST) wcf services or HttpModules that inspect incoming SWT tokens.
trans-unit.target: In some cases, assemblies are invoked through reflection, for example, when developing Representational State Transfer (REST) wcf services or HttpModules that inspect incoming SWT tokens.

trans-unit.source: To make sure these assemblies are deployed to <token>azure_2</token>, you must perform extra steps to add them to the deployment package.
trans-unit.target: To make sure these assemblies are deployed to <token>azure_2</token>, you must perform extra steps to add them to the deployment package.

trans-unit.source: To add assemblies that are invoked through reflection to the Windows Azure deployment package
trans-unit.target: To add assemblies that are invoked through reflection to the Windows Azure deployment package

trans-unit.source: Expand the <ui>bin</ui> folder of the cloud claims-aware web application or service.
trans-unit.target: Expand the <ui>bin</ui> folder of the cloud claims-aware web application or service.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the assembly, and then click <ui>Include In Project</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the assembly, and then click <ui>Include In Project</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the same library, and then click <ui>Properties</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the same library, and then click <ui>Properties</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Properties</ui> window, click <ui>Copy if newer</ui> for the <ui>Copy to Output Directory</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Properties</ui> window, click <ui>Copy if newer</ui> for the <ui>Copy to Output Directory</ui>.
